titleStmt.title: Vox lunaris being a philosophical & astrological discourse of two moons which were seen at London and the parts adjacent, June the eleventh 1679. a little before midnight. And what may in a course of nature be expected from this phasma in Europe. With some particular remarques upon the conjunctions of Saturn and Jupiter, and of the eclipses in Gemini, &c. for 120 years last past. By John Partridge student in Physick and Astrology.
titleStmt.author: Partridge, John, 1644-1715.

titleStmt.title: Vox lunaris being a philosophical & astrological discourse of two moons which were seen at London and the parts adjacent, June the eleventh 1679. a little before midnight. And what may in a course of nature be expected from this phasma in Europe. With some particular remarques upon the conjunctions of Saturn and Jupiter, and of the eclipses in Gemini, &c. for 120 years last past. By John Partridge student in Physick and Astrology.
titleStmt.author: Partridge, John, 1644-1715.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for William Bromwich at the Three Bibles, over against St. Martins Church within Ludgate,

notesStmt.note: The words "Philosophical & Astrological" are bracketed together on title page.
Identified as Wing (2nd ed.) P629 on UMI microfilm "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 1769.
Reproductions of the originals in the Trinity College (University of Cambridge) Library ("Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 1769), and the Bodleian Library (reel 2149).
